etymologies: early 17th century: from French, from marcher in the early sense ‘to trample’

definitions: the refuse of grapes or other fruit that has been pressed for winemaking

examples.text: the spent marc can be seen in purple-black piles by the roadside
each press takes a marc of 4,000 kilograms

shortDefinitions: refuse of grapes or other fruit that have been pressed for winemaking

definitions: an alcoholic spirit distilled from marc

examples.text: working men sat over bowls of milky coffee and glasses of marc
